text: Judson Campbell Logan (July 19, 1959 â€“ January 3, 2022) was an American athlete. He won a gold medal in the hammer throw at the 1987 Pan American Games in Indianapolis. He competed in four Summer Olympics, starting in 1984. His best finish was 13th in the qualifying round in 1984.Janosky, Mike (1992-08-09). BARCELONA; U.S. Female Shot-Putter Banned After Drug Test. New York Times. Retrieved on 2010-10-10. Logan was born in Ashland, Ohio. Logan died on January 3, 2022 from problems caused by COVID-19 in Canton, Ohio at the age of 62. He was being treated for leukemia before his death. ==References== Category:1959 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American track and field athletes Category:Hammer throwers Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Ohio Category:Olympians for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Ohio Category:People from Canton, Ohio
title: Jud Logan
